alert.note: Alert for Butler (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 16 at 8:31AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Indiana and Southwest Ohio, including the following counties, in Indiana, Dearborn, Franklin IN, Ripley and Union IN. In Southwest Ohio, Butler. * WHEN...Until 1030 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 831 AM EST, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Oxford, Monroe, Trenton, Franklin, Batesville, Brookville, South Middletown, Seven Mile, Darrtown, Williamsdale,New Miami, Sunman, Metamora, Millville and St. Leon.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
